title: Chicken Tagine with Preserved Lemon and Olives
description: The iconic Moroccan slow-cooked stew featuring tender chicken in an aromatic broth with preserved lemons, olives, and traditional spices.
instructions: In a small bowl, crush saffron threads and soak in 1/4 cup warm water.
Rinse preserved lemons, scrape out pulp, and cut rind into strips. Set aside.
In a large tagine or heavy pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add chopped onions and cook until soft and translucent, about 10 minutes.
Add minced garlic and grated fresh ginger, cook for 2 more minutes.
Add chicken pieces skin-side down and brown on all sides, about 10 minutes total.
Add all ground spices (ginger, cumin, paprika, turmeric, black pepper, salt) and soaked saffron with its water. Stir well to coat chicken.
Add chopped cilantro and parsley, reserving some for garnish.
Pour in 500ml water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 45 minutes.
After 45 minutes, add preserved lemon rinds and green olives. Continue cooking for another 30 minutes until chicken is very tender and falling off the bone.
Stir in lemon juice and adjust seasoning if needed. The sauce should be rich and slightly reduced.
Garnish with remaining fresh herbs and serve directly from the tagine with crusty bread or couscous.
